body:
Captain Marvel

• Domestic: $153M

• Global: $455M

• Second biggest solo superhero non-sequel launch

• Third biggest Marvel opening of all time

• Sixth biggest global launch ever

• IMDb rating currently at 7.1 from 200,000 user ratings.

• Rotten Tomato-meter 80%

The ONLY evidence suggesting Captain Marvel was bad is the audience score in RT, which is coming from only 54,000 users. Let’s not forget that the controversy surrounding Brie Larson is likely one of the reasons why people purposely gave it a low rating moments after the release.

But sure, the movie was a flop.

summary: Goose, the cat from Captain Marvel, is the star of a new, very nice meme
title: Goose, the cat from Captain Marvel, is the star of a new, very nice meme
excerpt: The writers, director, producers, and publicists behind Captain Marvel have done a lot of work to position their new movie as the story of a superpowered human being. Despite their best efforts, though, the internet understands that, really, everything in the film unrelated to its most notable character, an alien cat named Goose, is just background noise.
description: Cats RULE, dogs DROOL.  As a confirmed Cat Worshipper, I firmly believe the world would be a better place if cats were in charge of everything.  But hey, Marvel can start by making a Moose standalone film.

summary: I enjoyed Captain Marvel even more a second time. Again, I saw it in IMAX 3D, which is stunning. I love superheroes whose powers...
body: I enjoyed Captain Marvel even more a second time. Again, I saw it in IMAX 3D, which is stunning. I love superheroes whose powers revolve around light because the special effects are just awesome. I love the…lens flares, I suppose they are, when Carol is in space and absolutely intimidating the heck out of Ronan. Beautiful.

reblog.comment: I enjoyed Captain Marvel even more a second time. Again, I saw it in IMAX 3D, which is stunning. I love the…lens flares, I suppose they are, when Carol is in space and absolutely intimidating the heck out of Ronan. Beautiful.

summary: Brie Larson's complete style transformation from child star to superhero
title: Brie Larson's complete style transformation from child star to superhero
body:
Brie Larson made her official debut as “Captain Marvel” at the movie’s premiere in London this February dressed like a real life superhero. The star of the first solo female-hero film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe wowed in a deep royal blue custom Valentino Haute Couture off-the-shoulder gown with cutouts on the sides, finished with a matching gold and blue cape. 

We can only assume Larson will continue to serve stunning looks on the red carpet as she promotes her latest hit movie, but her fashion choices have definitely transformed from her early days as a child actress. 

Larson’s career began with movies like the Disney original “Right on Track” and “Sleepover.” She was one of the six chicks in “13 Going on 30.” And after starring in movies like “Scott Pilgrim vs. The World,” “21 Jump Street” and “The Gambler,” she won her first Oscar in 2015 for her role in “Room.”

In between filming, Larson has been fighting for more diverse reporters in the press rooms and acting as a leader in the Time’s Up movement. She’s a role model on and off screen, and her astounding fashion is only a complement to her wonderful character. 

See some of Brie Larson’s best fashion moments in the gallery above as she transitioned from Disney star to superhero.

title: #8: Hala, I'm Flying!
body:
Carol spends a little time with some women for once! Ms. Marvel faces off against M.O.D.O.K.! Astronauts train to become jujitsu warriors in the NASA gym! Carol and Mike’s strange date-combo-therapy session on the beach! Lots of sexism, lots of awkwardness, lots of discussion about Ms. Marvel #7 and #8!


Check out this episode!

summary: My one complaint about the Captain Mavel movie is that apparently hair ties don't exist in space so Carol's hair is either in...
body:
My one complaint about the Captain Mavel movie is that apparently hair ties don’t exist in space so Carol’s hair is either in her face or just about to be in front of her face for the entire film.

I have the same hair cut, I know what I’m talking about.

blog.name: bebe-benzenheimer
blog.title: Different is nice, but it sure isn't pretty
blog.description:
Sally. She/Her. Canadian. Capricorn. Perpetually old enough to know better and young enough not to care. BiMono. Egalitarian. Hugo Award 2019 nominee. Does not believe in hating whole demographics of people over an aspect of themselves they have no control over. Bands, books, Broadway, Princesses, Ponies, Idols, and nostalgia form my lifeblood. (aka I BE A FANGIRL) Once in a while I stumble into Popular Post Hell. Also RPF fan but not a tinhatter, and if you can't tell the difference don't bother following me.

If you're here for pictures and stories I occasionally churn out, check the "my edits" and "fanfic" tags. Simple requests are usually open. Am also offering graphics resources under the "psd" tag.

excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Captain Marvel (2019), Marvel Cinematic Universe
Rating: General Audiences
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Characters: Carol Danvers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Steve Rogers, Bruce Banner, James “Rhodey” Rhodes, Chewie | Goose (Marvel), Nick Fury (mentioned)
Additional Tags: Captain Marvel Spoilers, Carol meets the avengers, Endgame, Extended Scene, captain marvel mid credit scene, mentions of the snap and people getting dusted
Summary:

“Where is Fury?”
The rest of the group turns around at the sound of the voice and the Avengers are now face to face with an unknown woman standing in their base of operation.

A short continuation of the Captain Marvel mid-credit scene and what happens after Carol shows up. This means that this contains Spoilers from the movie.

summary: My very brief review of Captain Marvel
title: My very brief review of Captain Marvel
body:
Was it a good movie? Oh yeah, definitely

Should you see it? Yes, but see it for the right reasons. You shouldn’t see it because it is female lead, because you’re a feminist or such reason. See it because it is an entertaining, fun, memorable movie. Like honestly, I have never understood the “Women need women” argument, like they are claiming I can’t enjoy movies starring male actors. I don’t care about gender, I only care that the character is well written and movie is good. I have never had a problem with movies that feature a majority male cast, like LOTR, a dozen hot men- I am not complaining!

Does it have feminist propaganda? I caught very very little if even that. Captain Marvel’s gender was not even brought up when she was an adult. But yeah, if you fear it is going to be “men are useless pigs, women rule” kind of thing, don’t worry. In this movie, men and women are equals. It’s refreshing, really.

Best scene? Carol accepting her powers in full form, love the score. Although the use of the song “I’m just a girl” in the subsequent fight scene was a little jarring. 

Best relationship? Fury and Goose

How was Brie as Captain Marvel? Amazing, she really nailed the role. There was a lot of Buffy in her, she is witty, sarcastic but charming. Also, the Skrull make up looks vaguely like vampire masks from the show.

Is there anything annoying about it? Two things. The beginning is very cliched, it reminded me of Pocahontas “I have this recurring dream, I don’t know what it is about”. Of course, the story is full of cliches but it is still entertaining. 

Also, Captain Marvel is incredibly powerful. If she ever faces Thanos, he will be dead in a minute. Honestly, what are the other Avengers for? My guess is Carol kills Thanos and then it will be some sort of time travel movie.

But yeah, if you fear it is going to be “men are useless pigs, women rule” kind of thing, don’t worry. In this movie, men and women are equals. It’s refreshing, really.

Best scene? Carol accepting her powers in full form, love the score. Although the use of the song “I’m just a girl” in the subsequent fight scene was a little jarring. 

Best relationship? Fury and Goose

How was Brie as Captain Marvel? Amazing, she really nailed the role. There was a lot of Buffy in her, she is witty, sarcastic but charming. Also, the Skrull make up looks vaguely like vampire masks from the show.

Is there anything annoying about it? Two things. The beginning is very cliched, it reminded me of Pocahontas “I have this recurring dream, I don’t know what it is about”. Of course, the story is full of cliches but it is still entertaining. 

Also, Captain Marvel is incredibly powerful. If she ever faces Thanos, he will be dead in a minute. Honestly, what are the other Avengers for? My guess is Carol kills Thanos and then it will be some sort of time travel movie.

summary: All the time when I read CM as in Captain Marvel, I think people write CM as in Criminal Minds and I get really confused because...
body: All the time when I read CM as in Captain Marvel, I think people write CM as in Criminal Minds and I get really confused because I can never figure out who Carol is and I get really frustrated because I’ve watched every episode like three times and I’m usually so good with NAMES and also who is this TONY or NICK AND WHAT THE HELL WHY ARE EVERYBODY TALKING SO MUCH ABOUT EMILYS CAT and then I remember my new favourite movie exists
